t: Oh,*pn that You would rend the heavens! That*ld You would come down! That*ld the mountains might shake at Your presence—
As*ld fire burns brushwood, As*ld fire causes water to boil— To*ld make Your name known to Your adversaries, That*ild the nations may tremble at Your presence!
When*ld You did awesome things for*i which*i we did not look, You*ld came down, The*ld mountains shook at Your presence.
For*ld since the beginning of the world Men*ild have not heard nor perceived by the ear, Nor*ld has the eye seen any God besides You, Who*ld acts for the one who waits for Him.
You*ld meet him who rejoices and does righteousness, Who*ild remembers You in Your ways. You*ld are indeed angry, for we have sinned— In*ld these ways we continue; And*ld we need to be saved.
But*ln we are all like an unclean thing,*i And*ld all our righteousnesses are*i like filthy rags; We*ld all fade as a leaf, And*ld our iniquities, like the wind, Have*ld taken us away.
And*ld there*i is*i no one who calls on Your name, Who*ld stirs himself up to take hold of You; For*ld You have hidden Your face from us, And*ld have consumed us because of our iniquities.
But*ln now, O Lord,*s You*ld are*i our Father; We*ld are*i the clay, and You our potter; And*ld all we are*i the work of Your hand.
Do*ld not be furious, O Lord,*s Nor*ld remember iniquity forever; Indeed,*ld please look—we all are*i Your people!
Your*ld holy cities are a wilderness, Zion*ld is a wilderness, Jerusalem*ld a desolation.
Our*ld holy and beautiful temple, Where*ld our fathers praised You, Is*ld burned up with fire; And*ld all our pleasant things are laid waste.
Will*ld You restrain Yourself because of these things,*i O Lord?*s Will*ld You hold Your peace, and afflict us very severely?
